title: â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ Declared by Gavin Newsom Ahead of Super BowlÂ LX
summary: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œBad Bunny Dayâ€ across the state ahead of the singer's halftime performance.
body: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œ Bad Bunny Day â€ across the state, coinciding with Bad Bunnyâ€™s upcoming Super Bowl LX halftime performance in Santa Clara. â€œI am declaring tomorrow in California as â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ when Bad Bunny performs at the big game in the Golden State with his soothing, beautiful voice, and his very nice looks,â€ Newsom said via X on Saturday. Newsom later amplified his support with a tongue-in-cheek follow-up message, describing himself as â€œa tremendous lover of the Spanishâ€ and â€œa huge fan of Puerto Rico,â€ before adding, â€œWe love Bad Bunny! He is nearly as â€˜hotâ€™ as me â€” which is a big compliment, because there is nobody hotter. Happy Bad Bunny Day, America.â€ Support also came from Tim Cook, who praised the artist on social media ahead of the game in a selfie with the singer to social media. Bad Bunny, born Benito Antonio MartÃ­nez Ocasio, is set to deliver an all-Spanish halftime performance at Leviâ€™s Stadium during Super Bowl LX, marking one of the most prominent Spanish-language showcases in the eventâ€™s history. The appearance follows a landmark year for the Puerto Rican artist, who recently won Album of the Year at the 2026 Gramâ€¦

title: Backstreet Boys Share Bloopers, Behind-the-Scenes Video From T-Mobile Super BowlÂ Commercial
summary: The group chatted with Billboard ahead of the Super Bowl Sunday ad.
body: The Backstreet Boys bring a fun, reimagined version of “I Want It That Way” to T-Mobile’s 2026 Super Bowl commercial, which they filmed in New York City with a snowstorm looming. Related Backstreet Boys Warm Up to Sing on TV for Super Bowl Sunday in New Ad Teaser: ‘We’re So Back’ Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Diplo, Green Day & More Bad Bunny Ahead of Super Bowl: â€˜Iâ€™m Just a Normal Guy That Makes Musicâ€™ “We were hit with the winter storm right at the exact same time we were supposed to start filming,” BSB’s Nick Carter revealed in an interview with Billboard â€™s Tetris Kelly, noting, “There was a lot of adjustments that were being made at the time because we were supposed to do a two-day shoot.” That two-day schedule was condensed into one long day on set in the city at T-Mobile’s store in Times Square, where Carter says the temperature dropped to about six degrees, with snow imminent: “There’s a state of emergency basically in the city … The inside of the store was freezing. So every time that they opened the door it was like a wind tunnel, or like a refrigeâ€¦

title: Rock the Countryâ€™s South Carolina Stop Canceled After Several Artists ExitÂ Tour
summary: Anderson, S.C., was removed from the fest's schedule this week as the lineup shifted for the multi-date, Kid Rock-led event.
body: Amid Rock the Country’s lineup disruptions this week — with artists including Shinedown, Ludacris, Morgan Wade and Carter Faith making exits — the festival’s July 25-26 weekend in Anderson, S.C., is no longer on the schedule. Related Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up and Dance? Kid Rock Promises His Turning Point Halftime Show Will Be For People Who ‘Love Football, Love America, Love Good Music and Love Jesus’ Shinedown Pulls Out of Rock the Country Festival: ‘Our Band’s Purpose Is to Unite, Not Divide’ The South Carolina stop originally announced as part of an eight-city trek has been removed from Rock the Country’s website . Billboard reached out to a representative for Rock the Country for comment. Anderson County administrator’s was informed of the event being called off on Feb. 5, reports the Greenville, S.C., publication The Post and Courier . No specific reason for the cancellation was stated. As of Saturday (Feb. 7), the tour’s seven other stops remain on its schedule: Bellville, Texas (May 1-2); Bloomingdale, Ga. (May 29-30); Sioux Falls, S.D. (Jâ€¦

title: Green Dayâ€™s Billie Joe Armstrong Encourages ICE Agents to â€˜Quit That Sâ€”ty Jobâ€™ at Super BowlÂ Pre-Show
summary: The Bay Area trio took the stage at Pier 29 ahead of the big game.
body: Green Day â€™s Billie Joe Armstrong delivered a pointed political message during the bandâ€™s preâ€‘Super Bowl concert in San Francisco. During the punk-rock trioâ€™s performance on Friday (Feb. 6) at The FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify 2026 at Pier 29, Armstrong urged ICE agents to consider a different career path ahead of Sundayâ€™s (Feb. 8) big game between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots. Related Donald Trump Berates Bad Bunny, Green Day Ahead of Super Bowl Performances: ‘I’m Anti-Them’ Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up and Dance? Green Day’s Billie Joe Armstrong Pledges Support For ‘Brothers and Sisters in Minnesota’ Amid Ongoing ICE Immigration Raids â€œQuit your sâ€”ty ass job. Quit that shitty job you have,â€ the frontman told the crowd . â€œBecause when this is over, and it will be over at some point of time, Kristi Noem, Stephen Miller, JD Vance, Donald Trump â€” theyâ€™re gonna drop you like a bad fâ€”king habit. Come on to this side of the line.â€ Armstrongâ€™s remarks appeared to be aimed at ICE agents who might be in the Bay Area for Super Bowl LX, where Bad Bunny will perform during halfâ€¦

title: Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Ciara, Green Day &Â More
summary: From Becky G to Travis Scott, see all the music stars that joined 2026's Super Bowl parties in San Francisco.
body: The Bay Area filled up with celebrities from every industry for the 2026 Super Bowl, set to take place at Leviâ€™s Stadium on Sunday (Feb. 8) â€” and music stars were not the exception. As spectators gear up for the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks game that includes a historic headlining Super Bowl halftime show by Bad Bunny , many parties took place across San Francisco leading up to the big event. Billboard was present at many invite-only events, including the FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify that featured two rocking performances by Counting Crows and Green Day . The latter â€” formed by Billie Joe Armstrong, Mike Dirnt and TrÃ© Cool â€” is set to kick off this yearâ€™s Super Bowl opening ceremony with â€œtheir most iconic rock anthems,â€ the NFL previously announced . Meanwhile, Apple Music, which is presenting the Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show on Sunday, kicked off the weekend with a celebration at Apple Union Square that included special guests such as J Balvin , Becky G , Diplo , Travis Scott and Luis Fonsi , as well as a set by Bad Bunnyâ€™s official touring deejay, DJ Orma. â€œI just want people to have fun,â€ Bad Bunny said during a press conference ahead of his big shoâ€¦

title: Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After CancerÂ Battle
summary: The musician revealed his stage 4 kidney cancer diagnosis in May 2025.
body: Brad Arnold , a founding member and lead singer of 3 Doors Down , has died following a battle with cancer. He was 47. The musician passed away peacefully in his sleep on Saturday (Feb. 7), surrounded by his wife, Jennifer, and loved ones, the Mississippi-based rock band wrote on its official Instagram page. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2026 3 Doors Down Singer Brad Arnold Reveals Stage 4 Kidney Cancer Diagnosis: ‘I Have No Fear’ Rock the Country's South Carolina Stop Canceled After Several Artists Exit Tour “As a founding member, vocalist, and original drummer of 3 Doors Down, Brad helped redefine mainstream rock, blending post-grunge accessibility with emotionally direct songwriting and lyrical themes that resonated with everyday listeners,” the band wrote in a statement. 3 Doors Down announced in May 2025 that Arnold had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer and that the band would cancel its summer tour. In a video posted to social media at the time, Arnold shared the news himself, noting that he was battling clear cell renal cell carcinoma, which had spread to his lungs. â€œI have no fear. I really, sincerely am â€¦

title: 'Unstoppable at his best' - is Palmer in World Cup picture?
summary: By scoring a first-half hat-trick against Wolves on Saturday, Cole Palmer provided a timely reminder of his talent, putting himself firmly in the England conversation.

title: Ouattara scores late to give Brentford win over Newcastle
summary: Dango Ouattara scores in the 85th minute to give Brentford a 3-2 win over Newcastle United, as the visitors win their first game at St James' Park since 1934.

title: Everton produce second-half comeback to beat Fulham
summary: Everton score twice in the final fifteen minutes to secure a 2-1 away win over Fulham at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

title: Teenager Rayan scores as Bournemouth draw against Villa
summary: Bournemouth come from behind to earn a 1-1 draw with Aston Villa, thanks to a goal from Brazilian teenager Rayan on his first start for the club.

title: Gyokeres scores twice as Arsenal beat Sunderland
summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores two goals as Arsenal comfortably beat Sunderland 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points.

title: Romero red helps Man Utd continue perfect start under Carrick
summary: Goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Bruno Fernandes help Manchester United to a 2-0 win over 10-man Tottenham, who saw captain Cristian Romero sent off for the second time this season in the Premier League.

title: West Ham beat Burnley to boost survival hopes
summary: Goals from Crysencio Summerville and Taty Castellanos give West Ham a crucial 2-0 win against Burnley, to move them within three points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

title: Palmer scores first-half hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves
summary: Cole Palmer becomes the first player in Premier League history to score three career first-half hat-tricks, as Chelsea see off Wolves 3-1 at Molineux.

title: England intensity was superb from the start - Borthwick
summary: England head coach Steve Borthwick was delighted with his side's intensity from the beginning of the match and their defensive quality, during the 48-7 win over Wales in their first match of the Six Nations.

title: Lana Del Rey Teases Release Date for New Single, Credits Husband Jeremy Dufrene as aÂ Co-Writer
summary: The singerâ€™s long-delayed country project Stove was originally expected in January.
body: Lana Del Rey is giving fans an update on music from her long-delayed country album. On Saturday (Feb. 7), the 40-year-old singer-songwriter took to social media to tease the title and release date of her â€œfavoriteâ€ track from the upcoming project, Stove . Related Lana Del Rey Announces New Album â€˜Lassoâ€™ Rock the Country's South Carolina Stop Canceled After Several Artists Exit Tour Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong Encourages ICE Agents to 'Quit That S–ty Job' at Super Bowl Pre-Show â€œI just wanted to make a little message and let you know that my new single, my favorite song [from the new album] â€” this is the one Iâ€™ve been waiting for,â€ Del Rey said in a video shared to her Instagram Story . â€œ’White Feather Hawk Tail Deer Hunter’ is coming out on the 17th,â€ she added, without specifying the month, though itâ€™s presumably February. The songstress noted that she worked on the track with producers Drew Erickson and Jack Antonoff, who “finally found that magical chord that I was missing.” The song was co-written with her husband, Jeremy Dufrene, her brother-in-law, and her sister Caroline â€œChuckâ€ Grant, with mixing handled by Dean Râ€¦

title: Team GB skeleton helmet appeal dismissed by Cas
summary: The British skeleton team - among Team GB's best hopes for medals at the Winter Olympics - will not be able to wear their new helmets after the Court of Arbitration for Sport said they do not comply with the sport's rules around shape.

title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

title: Boulter seals fourth WTA title with Ostrava Open win
summary: Britain's Katie Boulter claims her fourth WTA Tour title with a three-set victory against Tamara Korpatsch at the Ostrava Open on Saturday.

title: Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up andÂ Dance?
summary: Thousands of opinions are flying around. But in the end, this is really about music.
body: Iâ€™m going to wager that no other Super Bowl Halftime Show artist in history has garnered as much chatter, opinion, controversy or opinion pieces as Bad Bunny , who will perform on Sunday (Feb. 8) at the final between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots in Santa Clara, California. Backed by a choir dressed in Italy’s flag colors, Pausini â€” wearing an elegant black open-shoulder gown by Giorgio Armani â€” delivered an emotional performance that set the tone for the global event, celebrating Italyâ€™s rich history. The anthem was written by Goffredo Mameli in the 1800s, serving as a powerful reminder of Italy’s fight for unity and independence.
